featured.text: Water is more useful to mankind than diamonds, and yet 26 are costlier.
If we 30 surrounded by an unending abundance of diamonds, we probably wouldn’t value them very much.
Being a rare natural resource, diamonds are 27 in supply.
Called the diamond-water paradox, this is a classic problem posed to students of economics.
Hence, diamonds carry a higher monetary value than water, even though we find more use for water.

definition.zh_def: 一種由碳元素組成的寶石，具有極高的硬度和光澤，常用於珠寶和工業用途。
definition.en_def: A precious stone made of carbon, known for its exceptional hardness and brilliance, commonly used in jewelry and industrial applications.
definition.example: She received a beautiful diamond ring for her birthday.
